description: From Middle English wrighte, wriȝte, wruhte, wurhte, from Old English wyrhta (“worker, maker”), from Proto-West Germanic *wurhtijō (as in *wurkijan), from Proto-Indo-European *werǵ- (“to work”) (English work). Cognate with wrought, dated Dutch wrecht.

entries.meaning: (obsolete except in compounds) A builder or maker of something.

verbs.description: wright (third-person singular simple present wrights, present participle wrighting, simple past and past participle wrighted)
